alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Ralls (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 12:58AM CDT until June 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Monroe County in northeastern Missouri... Northwestern Ralls County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 700 AM CDT Wednesday. * At 1258 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroe City, Paris, Madison, Granville, Woodlawn, Holliday, Stoutsville, Florida, Indian Creek, The Landing and Duncans Bridge. This includes the following State Parks... Union Covered Bridge Historic Site and Mark Twain Lake Recreational Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
